title: Justin Bieber says he and Taylor Swift have 'always been cool'
text:
Earlier this month their long-running feud seemed to bubble up again - this time over a banana.

But Justin Bieber has insisted he and Taylor Swift are still 'cool,' in video taken in Los Angeles on Tuesday.

In paparazzi footage published on YouTube, the 25-year-old Baby hitmaker is asked if he and the Shake It Off songstress are on friendly terms, Justin appeared to say 'We've always been cool'.

'Homies': Justin Bieber has insisted he and Taylor Swift are still 'cool,' in video taken in Los Angeles on Tuesday. The pair seen here in 2011

The video, captured outside Justin's recording studio, showed the What Do You Mean singer rolling up to waiting photographers in his Mercedes-Benz G-Wagon.

When pressed about the status of his relationship with Taylor, he said 'I’m done with all that other stuff. Other people’s drama is not my drama.'

Justin's wife Hailey Bieber recently leapt to his defense after he was attacked by Taylor Swift fans for 'mocking' the singer.

The Biebers: Justin's wife Hailey Bieber [R] recently leapt to his defense after he was attacked by Taylor Swift fans for 'mocking' the singer

Love Yourself singer Bieber, who has a long and complicated history with Taylor, recreated her viral post-surgery freak out over a banana.

On Instagram Live he stood in his large designer kitchen and shouted: 'It's not the banana I wanted! It's not the right banana. It has no head.'

His wife Hailey filmed his efforts, and assured him 'that was so funny'.

But the video didn't go down as well with Swift's fans - coming as it did, just three months after Swift accused Bieber of bullying.

Early Monday morning Hailey took to Twitter to defend her husband from Swift's outraged fans.

Sharing a video of a distressed Swift fan, Hailey wrote: 'I never knew I could make somebody so upset... truly I'm so sorry you're THIS upset?! Lord have mercy I hope I'm never this upset about someone I don't know!!'

Bully boys? Once friends, Taylor and Justin's relationship declined in June this year, after she accused both him and his manager Scooter Braun [L] of bullying her

Better things: Taylor is focusing on her relationship with new beau Joe Alwyn, seen here with the songstress this month

Once friends, Taylor and Justin's relationship declined in June this year, after she accused both him and his manager Scooter Braun of bullying her, after Scooter purchased Big Machine Records, who owns the majority of Taylor's master recordings.

In a blog post, Taylor claimed she was never given the choice to buy the masters herself and she is 'sad and grossed out' that they are now owned by Scooter, claiming it is her 'worst case scenario'.

Justin - who is managed by Scooter - replied publicly, writing: 'What were you trying to accomplish by posting that blog? seems to me like it was to get sympathy u also knew that in posting that your fans would go and bully scooter.'

The message Taylor posted included an Instagram post of Justin Facetiming Scooter and Kanye West, with the caption 'taylor what up'.

Apologizing for his 'hurtful' message, Bieber said: 'Hey Taylor. First of all i would like to apologize for posting that hurtful instagram post, at the time i thought it was funny but looking back it was distasteful and insensitive.'
description: Justin Bieber has insisted he and Taylor Swift are still 'cool,' in video taken in Los Angeles on Tuesday.
